Spoiler alert: No equalizer. That's the only reason I got this app. Why else would I? The only redeeming function of the Alexa Moto Mod was it's speaker, which seems to be deliberately tuned poorly, so an official equalizer would actually be useful. Instead, we get a useless app for a defunct mod.

I like having this on my x4. A lot of complaints by others, about lack of features such as reminders and music. This is unfortunate but I don't think it's a reflection of the app. Amazon doesn't allow any of those features except on Echo speakers, probably because if they did, people wouldn't have an incentive to buy the Amazon Echo devices to get access to full Alexa functionality. So yeah, I think this app is great.

I love t for the speaker, but as far as Alexa is concerned, this seriously needs more Alexa features. My main issue is that it won't work with Spotify even though every other Alexa device will. Or radio, or Netflix, or my Plex server. About all it does is bark like a dog, and tell me the weather. This should work with reminders, Spotify, or even opening up a Google search. Please update software to enable as these little things would make this a truly standout reason to buy a Moto

It AI app is to bad

I have the Motorola Moto X4 and I purchased it solely for Alexa.  Unfortunately, the app needs some serious work and I encourage you to fix some major issues like lack of follow-up responses in skills (it won't make it through 3 questions playing Jeopardy before just shutting down) and continuous false activations even with customized training.  But my biggest issue is this: before one of the recent updates, Moto Alexa made a notification sound immediately after hearing the wake word.  Now, the sound is made after "Alexa" is heard and a command is initiated.  This is fine if you are always looking at the screen to see if the app is listening, but I am disabled and use the phone with a headset.  My voice is very weak and isn't consistent throughout the day saying the "Alexa" command (even with multiple attempts at training).  Three fourths of the time, my phone does not recognize me saying the command so I have to just stand there looking like an idiot saying over and over "Alexa what time is it" not knowing whether it even heard me or not.  Before, I could just say "Alexa" and wait, and if I didn't hear the notification sound, I would know.  Please make this at least an option in the configuration screen

It's built to get your foot in the door in using Alexa, but you will have to download Amazon's Alexa full app on top of the Moto app to take advantage of some of things the echo does. Three stars is for having to reinstall the Moto app to get the voice recognition to work correctly.

Triggers by itself constantly running my battery down or just spying. I have 3 echo dots and they work great, this app is not the same in that it seems very glitchy. Perhaps it's because I don't have a Moto Alexa speaker mod attached but not sure it would make a difference since other users seem to be rating this poorly with the same feedback as me. Glad I didn't drop $100 on a moto Alexa mod. In my opinion updates should be being released weekly to patch and fix the bugs but it would appear this particular Amazon echo Experience is being left out and is failing miserably. I love the convenience of having an echo on my phone and considered getting the mod but unless I see ratings go up and patches go through fixing all of the bugs, they won't be getting any money from me.
